title: Show timezone-aware date in Timetable balloons

milestone.title: v2.0
milestone.description:
This version will provide:

* a complete new DB backend (RDBMS)
* a more modular Indico
* a brand-new namespace

body: Timetable balloons are currently showing times in the event's timezone, regardless of the user's preference.

title: Wrong text at radio button "Inherit from parent material" when uploading 2nd resource of material type in restricted event
body:
``` yaml
# Ticket imported from Trac
# Reported by: s.hesselbach
```

Use case: material is to be uploaded to restricted event.

When first resource of matrial type (e.g. slides) is uploaded everything is fine. The text at the first radio button says:
"Inherit from parent Conference (currently restricted to some users, but can change)"
See ![Upload1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2848217/4523099/f5cbd4a4-4d32-11e4-94af-a40bc8e2a790.png)

However if second (or further) resource is uploaded it says:
"Inherit from parent material type "Slides" (currently open to everyone, but can change)",
despite the fact that the matrial type Slides here is protected because it inherits from a protected event.
See ![Upload2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2848217/4523105/0e675f92-4d33-11e4-8ac6-d94bee70f78c.png)

title: Misleading message in Room Booking

milestone.title: v1.9
milestone.description:
Internal release that will include:

* Room Booking Module migrated to new RDBMS.
* New Whoosh Indexer for Category and Event names.

body:
The following message is misleading:

![image001](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2699/5026121/d6d58318-6b20-11e4-9cad-d01eaa4e36a3.png)

_"Unable to book! This room is not available for the day(s) you have selected"_

It is false, as sometimes the collision involves only part of the day, not all of it.

title: Reminders: Date format not accepted when  re-editing the time
body:
1) Create a reminder
2) later, revisit it and edit the time (not the date)
3) try to save: Wrong date, possibly causing an date is in the past error.

Date formatting after intial editing:  d/m/yyyy
![screenshot-indico frm2 tum de 2017-09-08 08-29-36](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5336494/30198810-17475c66-9470-11e7-8ed2-2e09add0b5e5.png)

Date formatting during re-edit: yyyy/m/d
![screenshot-indico frm2 tum de 2017-09-08 08-30-17](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5336494/30198811-17480f8a-9470-11e7-9e06-5ba4f6334a16.png)

While  it can be fixed  byalways touching the date as well, it is a bit annoying and may lead to wrong dates.

title: Registration form field reordering sometimes breaks
body:
To reproduce:

1. Create new regform
2. Add fields: A, B
3. Move B above A
4. Move Affiliation below B
5. Move Email below B
6. Move LastName below Email

New order is: Title FirstName Email LastName Affiliation A B
Expected: Title FirstName B Email LastName Affiliation A

title: Logs: Wrong date assignment
body:
In the indico log view (reports -> logs ) the  date assignment seems wrong:
time from 00:00 to 00:59 seem to be assigned to the previous day.

See screenshot, the first 2 listed on May 11th  were actually submitted on May 12th (at 00:xx ) 
![screenshot-indico frm2 tum de 2018-05-14 08-06-27](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5336494/39980876-913742e4-573d-11e8-8057-aacf8f533cbc.png)

title: When using the scroll bar with the mouse in select items in a regform, scrolling does not work
body:
**Describe the bug**
If you use a select item in a regform that has enough items to enable scrolling (like country), the user may scroll with the wheel / touchpad, but if the scroll bar is clicked on to scroll "the old way", the options closes instead of allowing to scroll by clicking.

**To Reproduce**
1. create an event and a regform, add the country field
2. try to scroll via clicking 

**Expected behavior**
scrolling should be possible via scrollbar 

**Additional context**
[sandbox event.](https://sandbox.getindico.io/event/4588/registrations/1570/)

title: Template rendering results in Invalid HTML

milestone.title: v2.2
milestone.description: A rewrite of the Room Booking Module UI, which will allow us to stop depending on Mako and remove a good amount of legacy JS code. We'll be introducing React, Redux and Semantic UI React.

body:
For an event with one or more badge/poster, the rendered page for /event/<event_id>/manage/designer/ results in invalid html -- as the template logic results in multiple elements with same html id. An example of one such error (as reported by online validation service at html5.validator.nu) is:

Error: Duplicate ID template-list.
From line 777, column 13; to line 777, column 61
          <table class="i-table-widget" id="template-list">

Problem encountered running on 2.2-maintenance commit fee7cad5912b20d2e3d64bbad14571cb11c852e8 -- and raised in this forum discussion:
https://talk.getindico.io/t/how-to-extend-a-core-template-macro/1363/13

To Reproduce: select an event with one or more badge or poster templates, and validate the source HTML.

title: Modify string for the description of the fields.
body:
**Change string under the registration form management area for the fields **
The following two strings describing the field must be replaced:

1. Publish registrations
2. Publish number of registrations
The existing description is "Registrations from this form will be displayed **in** the event page" & "Number of registered participants will be displayed **in** the event page". The preposition "**in**" must be replaced by "**on**".

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'https://v2-reg-demo.unog.ch/event/396/manage/registration'
3. Under the list of registration forms, click on '**Manage**'
4. Click on Edit in front of the General settings
5. Scroll to the fields "Publish registrations" & "Publish number of registrations"
6. See the error in the description of the aforementioned two fields.

**Expected behavior**
The description string preposition must be replaced from "in the event" to "on the event page" for both fields.

**Screenshots**

![2022-08-05_152535](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/88734005/183086910-08ef9e6d-6489-4468-9dd1-da886c6a564e.png)

title: Pressing "return" when setting minimum capacity goes to next page

milestone.title: v1.9
milestone.description:
Internal release that will include:

* Room Booking Module migrated to new RDBMS.
* New Whoosh Indexer for Category and Event names.

body:
We're talking about `/rooms/book` of course.
If you set a number for "capacity" and press "return", the form will be submitted and the next page will show up. Using the slider works fine, though. This behavior should be fixed. Either we update live (no "return" needed) and ignore the "return" key code, or refresh on return, avoiding the submit.

Steps to reproduce:

title: Broken link in custom menu if tilte contains Russian letters only

milestone.title: v2.2
milestone.description: A rewrite of the Room Booking Module UI, which will allow us to stop depending on Mako and remove a good amount of legacy JS code. We'll be introducing React, Redux and Semantic UI React.

body:
**Describe the bug**
Broken link in custom menu if tilte contains Russian letters only

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create custom menu in conference in (/manage/layout/menu/)
2. "Add page"
3. In title specify Russian letters only.
4. Switch to display view
5. Click on link and one can see that link is  broken
